definition.name: Continuous Benchmark
definition.description: Continuous Benchmark using GitHub pages as dash board for keeping performance
definition.author: github-action-benchmark developers <https://github.com/benchmark-action>

inputs.name: name
inputs.description: Name of the benchmark. This value must be identical among all benchmarks

inputs.name: tool
inputs.description: Tool to use get benchmark output. One of "cargo", "go", "benchmarkjs", "pytest", "googlecpp", "catch2", "julia", "benchmarkdotnet", "customBiggerIsBetter", "customSmallerIsBetter"

inputs.name: output-file-path
inputs.description: A path to file which contains the benchmark output

inputs.name: gh-pages-branch
inputs.description: Branch for gh-pages

inputs.name: gh-repository
inputs.description: Url to an optional different repository to store benchmark results

inputs.name: benchmark-data-dir-path
inputs.description: Path to directory which contains benchmark files on GitHub pages branch

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: GitHub API token to pull/push GitHub pages branch and deploy GitHub pages. For public repository, this must be personal access token for now. Please read README.md for more details

inputs.name: ref
inputs.description: optional Ref to use when finding commit

inputs.name: auto-push
inputs.description: Push GitHub Pages branch to remote automatically. This option requires github-token input

inputs.name: skip-fetch-gh-pages
inputs.description: Skip pulling GitHub Pages branch before generating an auto commit

inputs.name: comment-always
inputs.description: Leave a comment with benchmark result comparison. To enable this feature, github-token input must be given as well

inputs.name: summary-always
inputs.description: Leave a job summary with benchmark result comparison

inputs.name: save-data-file
inputs.description: Save the benchmark data to external file

inputs.name: comment-on-alert
inputs.description: Leave an alert comment when current benchmark result is worse than previous. Threshold is specified with alert-threshold input. To enable this feature, github-token input must be given as well

inputs.name: alert-threshold
inputs.description: Threshold which determines if an alert should happen or not. Percentage value such as "150%". For example, 150% means that an alert happens when current benchmark result is 1.5x worse than previous

inputs.name: fail-on-alert
inputs.description: Workflow fails when alert comment happens

inputs.name: fail-threshold
inputs.description: Threshold which determines if the current workflow fails. Format is the same as alert-threshold input. If this value is not specified, the same value as alert-threshold is used

inputs.name: alert-comment-cc-users
inputs.description: Comma separated GitHub user names which start with @ (e.g. "@foo,@bar"). They will be mentioned in commit comment for alert.

inputs.name: external-data-json-path
inputs.description: JSON data file for storing benchmark results. When this input is set, github-action-benchmark no longer uses Git branch to store data. Instead, it reads and appends benchmark data from/to the file. User must store the file anywhere

inputs.name: max-items-in-chart
inputs.description: Max data points in a benchmark chart to avoid making the chart too busy. Value must be unsigned integer. No limit by default
